meanings.definition: To mark (a piece of mail) with an official signature or stamp to show that postage has been paid.
meanings.sent1: She carefully franked the envelope before sending it out.
meanings.sent2: The post office franked the package to indicate it was ready for delivery.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to frank the letter with its paw, leaving cute little prints all over.
meanings.sent4: His smile franked the letter with warmth and sincerity.
meanings.sent5: The bright red stamp franked the envelope, making it stand out in the mailbox.

meanings.definition: A mark or signature on a piece of mail indicating that postage has been paid.
meanings.sent1: The franking on the envelope showed it was ready to be sent.
meanings.sent2: She looked for the franking on the letter to confirm it was paid for.
meanings.sent3: The franking on the postcard was so fancy, it looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: His unique franking on the package made it easily recognizable.
meanings.sent5: The missing franking on the parcel caused a delay in its delivery.

meanings.definition: The privilege of sending mail without payment of postage.
meanings.sent1: Having the franking allowed her to send letters without worrying about stamps.
meanings.sent2: He appreciated the franking as it saved him money on postage.
meanings.sent3: The franking made her feel like a VIP in the world of mail.
meanings.sent4: The franking was like a golden ticket for sending mail for free.
meanings.sent5: Winning the contest gave him the exclusive franking privilege for a year.
